observationText: The c.1185+1G > A NF1-mutant hiPSCs exhibited increased RAS activity and RAS-regulated cell proliferation similar to patient-derived NPCs and organoids with the same mutation, as well as mouse models with analogous Nf1 mutations.

The c.1185+1G > A NF1-mutant hiPSC line was one of the lines that successfully generated cerebral organoids exhibiting increased NPC proliferation, increased apoptosis, but similar numbers of immature neurons compared to controls.
The c.1185+1G > A NF1-mutant hiPSC line retained expression of the remaining wild-type NF1 allele, as confirmed by DNA and RNA sequencing.
The c.1185+1G > A NF1-mutant hiPSC line was generated using CRISPR/Cas9 technology to engineer the heterozygous mutation into a control human iPSC line.
The c.1185+1G > A NF1-mutant hiPSC line was one of multiple isogenic NF1-mutant hiPSC lines generated to model different patient mutations in the NF1 gene.
